content.description: Start up the obvous crack/flake in the center of the face which peters out to thin face climbing between reachy holds. The crux comes high on this one which makes it a bit more sketchy than The Anti-Socialist. Which is sure to weed out the Snowflakes and send them back to their safe space...
content.location: Center of the face starting in an obvous crack and trending slightly left.

content.description:
A seemingly impossible slab best suited for a crisp cool day and sharp edges on new shoes.

This route may very well quickly have you questioning whether its even possible or not, and certainly show you just where you stand as far as good foot technique. Great for developing that coveted tendinitis in your toes from miles of thin slabby edging.

Can be TR'd from anchors on the top and a directional piton.
content.location: Located on the far left side of the boulder, just to the right of where the black lichen meets the crisp clean orange granite. Stay out of the black stuff unless you want to be scating down the face.

content.description: An obvious natural line up the right side of the boulder. Start on the Left hand pinch and a foot up high in the good square slot and dyno for a good hidden edge with your right hand. Now pull through on good holds until you can get established on the rock, then follow the moderate but runnout crack system as it gently gets steeper to the top.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the boulder.
